The summoned creature magically appears in the hat and tries to get away from you as quickly as possible. The creature is neither friendly nor hostilea445 and it isn't under your control. It behaves as an ordinary creature of its kind and disappears after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 hit points. The hat regains all expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Hat of Wizardry
Description: This antiquateda445 cone—shaped hat is adorned with gold crescent moons and stars. While you are wearing ita445 you gain the following benefits:a446You can use the hat as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells.a446You can try to cast a cantrip that you don't know. The cantrip must be on the wizard spell lista445 and you must make a DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) check. If the check succeedsa445 you cast the spell. If the check failsa445 so does the spella445 and the action used to cast the spell is wasted. In either casea445 you can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

Name: Cap of Water Breathing
Description: While wearing this cap underwatera445 you can speak its command word as an action to create a bubble of air around your head. It allows you to breathe normally underwater. This bubble stays with you until you speak the command word againa445 the cap is removeda445 or you are no longer underwater.

Name: Circlet of Blasting
Description: While wearing this circleta445 you can use an action to cast the scorching ray spell with it. When you make the spell's attacksa445 you do so with an attack bonus of +5. The circlet can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Name: Hat of Disguise
Description: While wearing this hata445 you can use an action to cast the disguise self spell from it at will. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

Name: Headband of Intellect
Description: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you wear this headband. It has no effect on you if your Intelligence is already 19 or higher without it.

Name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
Description: While wearing this helma445 you can use an action to cast the comprehend languages spell from it at will.

Name: Helm of Telepathy
Description: While wearing this helma445 you can use an action to cast the detect thoughts spell (save DC 13) from it. As long as you maintain concentration on the spella445 you can use a bonus action to send a telepathic message to a creature you are focused on. It can reply—using a bonus action to do so—while your focus on it continues.a446While focusing on a creature with detect thoughtsa445 you can use an action to cast the suggestion spell (save DC 13) from the helm on that creature. Once useda445 the suggestion property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Name: Spies’ Murmur
Description: This headpiecea445 crafted from dark metala445 is worn curved around the ear. If you know a creature wearing another Spies' Murmur and that creature is within 1 mile of youa445 you can communicate telepathically with each other. As a bonus actiona445 you can allow that creature to hear everything you hear for 1 hour. You can end this effect as a bonus actiona445 and it ends if you're incapacitated.

Name: Helm of Teleportation
Description: This helm has 3 charges. While wearing ita445 you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast the teleport spell from it. The helm regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Ioun Stone – Awareness
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446You can't be surprised while this dark blue rhomboid orbits your head.

Name: Ioun Stone – Protection
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446You gain a +1 bonus to AC while this dusty rose prism orbits your head.

Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Name: Ioun Stone – Sustenance
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446You don't need to eat or drink while this clear spindle orbits your head.

Name: Knave’s Eyepatch
Description: While wearing this eye patcha445 you gain these benefits:a446You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.a446If you have the Sunlight Sensitivity traita445 you are unaffected by the trait.a446You are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts or determine whether you are lying. Creatures can communicate telepathically with you only if you allow it.

Name: Helm of Brilliance
Spells Needed: daylight fireball prismatic spray wall of fire
Description: This dazzling helm is set with 1d10 diamondsa445 2d10 rubiesa445 3d10 fire opalsa445 and 4d10 opals. Any gem pried from the helm crumbles to dust. When all the gems are removed or destroyeda445 the helm loses its magic.a446You gain the following benefits while wearing it:a446You can use an action to cast one of the following spells (save DC 18)a445 using one of the helm's gems of the specified type as a component: daylight (opal)a445 fireball (fire opal)a445 prismatic spray (diamond)a445 or wall of fire (ruby). The gem is destroyed when the spell is cast and disappears from the helm.a446As long as it has at least one diamonda445 the helm emits dim light in a 30-foot radius when at least one undead is within that area. Any undead that starts its turn in that area takes 1d6 radiant damage.a446As long as the helm has at least one rubya445 you have resistance to fire damage.a446As long as the helm has at least one fire opala445 you can use an action and speak a command word to cause one weapon you are holding to burst into flames. The flames emit bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The flames are harmless to you and the weapon. When you hit with an attack using the blazing weapona445 the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage. The flames last until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or stow the weapon.a446Roll a d20 if you are wearing the helm and take fire damage as a result of failing a saving throw against a spell. On a roll of 1a445 the helm emits beams of light from its remaining gems. Each creature within 60 feet of the helm other than you must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be struck by a beama445 taking radiant damage equal to the number of gems in the helm. The helm and its gems are then destroyed.

Name: Ioun Stone – Absorbtion
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. If you are targeted by a spell whose level is higher than the number of spell levels the stone has lefta445 the stone can't cancel it.

Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446Your Intelligence score increases by 2a445 to a maximum of 20a445 while this marbled scarlet and blue sphere orbits your head.

Name: Ioun Stone – Leadership
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446Your Charisma score increases by 2a445 to a maximum of 20a445 while this marbled pink and green sphere orbits your head.

Name: Peregrine Mask
Description: While wearing this winged helma445 you have a flying speed of 60 feet. In additiona445 you have advantage on initiative rolls.

Name: Ioun Stone – Strength
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446Your Strength score increases by 2a445 to a maximum of 20a445 while this pale blue rhomboid orbits your head.

Name: Ioun Stone – Greater Absorbtion
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446While this marbled lavender and green ellipsoid orbits your heada445 you can use your reaction to cancel a spell of 8th level or lower cast by a creature you can see and targeting only you. Once the stone has canceled 50 levels of spellsa445 it burns out and turns dull graya445 losing its magic. If you are targeted by a spell whose level is higher than the number of spell levels the stone has lefta445 the stone can't cancel it.

Name: Ioun Stone – Mastery
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446Your proficiency bonus increases by 1 while this pale green prism orbits your head.

Name: Ioun Stone – Regeneration
Description: An Ioun stone is named after Iouna445 a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exista445 each type a distinct combination of shape and color.a446When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the aira445 the stone orbits your head at a distance of 1d3 feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereaftera445 another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from youa445 either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stonea445 ending its effect.a446A stone has AC 24a445 10 hit pointsa445 and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.a446You regain 15 hit points at the end of each hour this pearly white spindle orbits your heada445 provided that you have at least 1 hit point.

Name: Lost Crown of Besilmer
Description: This dwarven battle-helm consists of a sturdy open-faced steel helmeta445 decorated with a golden circlet above the brow from which seven small gold spikes project upward. You gain the following benefits while wearing the crown:a446You have resistance to psychic damage.a446You have advantage on saving throws against effects that would charm you.a446You can use a bonus action to inspire one creature you can see that is within 60 feet of you and that can see or hear you. Once before the end of your next turna445 the inspired creature can roll a d6 and add the number rolled to one ability checka445 attack rolla445 or saving throw it makes. This uses 1 charge from the crown. It has 3 chargesa445 and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Ersatz Eye
Description: This artificial eye replaces a real one that was lost or removed. While the ersatz eye is embedded in your eye socketa445 it can't be removed by anyone other than youa445 and you can see through the tiny orb as though it were a normal eye.

Name: Eyes of Charming
Description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. They have 3 charges. While wearing thema445 you can expend 1 charge as an action to cast the charm person spell (save DC 13) on a humanoid within 30 feet of youa445 provided that you and the target can see each other. The lenses regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
Description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing thema445 you can see much better than normal out to a range of 1 foot. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight while searching an area or studying an object within that range.

Name: Eyes of the Eagle
Description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing thema445 you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibilitya445 you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

Name: Goggles of Night
Description: While wearing these dark lensesa445 you have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvisiona445 wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

Name: Mask of the Beast
Description: This wooden mask is shaped in the likeness of a beast's visage and has 3 charges. While wearing the mask you can expend 1 charge and use the mask to cast the animal friendship spell as an action. The mask regains all expended charges at dawn.

Name: Black Dragon Mask
Description: This horned mask of glossy ebony has horns and a skull-like mien. The mask reshapes to fit a wearer attuned to it. While you are wearing the mask and attuned to ita445 you can access the following properties.a446Damage Absorption. You have damage resistance to acid. If you already have damage resistance to acid from another sourcea445 you gain immunity to acid damage. If you already have immunity to acid damage from another sourcea445 you regain hit points equal to half of any acid damage you are dealt.a446Draconic Majesty. While you are wearing no armora445 you can add your Charisma bonus to your Armor Class.a446Dragon Breath. If you have a breath weapon that requires rest to rechargea445 it gains a recharge of 6.a446Dragon Sight. You gain darkvision with a radius of 60 feeta445 or an additional 60 feet of darkvision if you already have that sense. Once per daya445 you can gain blindsight out to a range of 30 feet for 5 minutes.a446Dragon Tongue. You can speak and understand Draconic. You also have advantage on any Charisma check you make against Black dragons.a446Legendary Resistance. (1/Day) If you fail a saving throwa445 you can choose to succeed instead.a446Water Breathing. You can breathe underwater.

Name: Clockwork Amulet
Description: This copper amulet contains tiny interlocking gears and is powered by magic from Mechanusa445 a plane of clockwork predictability. A creature that puts an ear to the amulet can hear faint ticking and whirring noises coming from within.a446When you make an attack roll while wearing the amuleta445 you can forgo rolling the d20 to get a 10 on the die. Once useda445 this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Name: Dark Shard Amulet
Description: This amulet is fashioned from a single shard of resilient extraplanar material originating from the realm of your warlock patron. While you are wearing ita445 you gain the following benefits:a446You can use the amulet as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.a446You can try to cast a cantrip that you don't know. The cantrip must be on the warlock spell lista445 and you must make a DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) check. If the check succeedsa445 you cast the spell. If the check failsa445 so does the spella445 and the action used to cast the spell is wasted. In either casea445 you can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

Name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
Description: While wearing this amuleta445 you are hidden from divination magic. You can't be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Name: Brooch of Shielding
Description: While wearing this broocha445 you have resistance to force damagea445 and you have immunity to damage from the magic missile spell.

Name: Medallion of Thoughts
Description: The medallion has 3 charges. While wearing ita445 you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast the detect thoughts spell (save DC 13) from it. The medallion regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Necklace of Adaption
Description: While wearing this necklacea445 you can breathe normally in any environmenta445 and you have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as cloudkill and stinking cloud effectsa445 inhaled poisonsa445 and the breath weapons of some dragons).

Name: Periapt of Health
Description: You are immune to contracting any disease while you wear this pendant. If you are already infected with a diseasea445 the effects of the disease are suppressed while you wear the pendant.

Name: Periapt of Wound Closure
Description: While you wear this pendanta445 you stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn. In additiona445 whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit pointsa445 double the number of hit points it restores.

Name: Amulet of Health
Description: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher. Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location Wondrous item  uncommon (requires attunement) While wearing this amulet  you are hidden from divination magic. You can’t be targeted by such magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

Name: Amulet of Protection from Turning
Description: While you wear this amulet of silver and turquoisea445 you have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.a446If you fail a saving throw against such an effecta445 you can choose to succeed instead. You can do so three timesa445 and expended uses recharge daily at dawn. Each time an effect that turns undead is used against youa445 the amulet glows with silvery blue light for a few seconds.

Name: Periapt of Proof Against Poison
Description: This delicate silver chain has a brilliant-cut black gem pendant. While you wear ita445 poisons have no effect on you. You are immune to the poisoned condition and have immunity to poison damage.

Name: Amulet of the Black Skull
Description: This amulet is carved from obsidian and shaped like a screaming humanoid skulla445 with ruby eyes and emeralds for teeth. It hangs from an iron chain necklace.a446The amulet has 6 charges and regains 1d6 charges daily at dawn. While wearing the amuleta445 you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to transport yourself and anything you are wearing or carrying to a location within 100 feet of you. The destination you choose doesn't need to be in your line of sighta445 but it must be familiar to you (in other wordsa445 a place you have seen or visited)a445 and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. This effect isn't subject to the magic restrictions placed on the Tomb of the Nine Gods; thusa445 the amulet can be used to enter and exit the tomb.a446If you aren't undeada445 you must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw each time you use the amulet to teleport. On a failed saving throwa445 the black skull cackles as you are transformed in transit. The transformation takes effect as soon as you arrive at the destinationa445 and is determined randomly by rolling percentile dice and consulting the Black Skull Transformation table.a446Black Skull Transformationa446d100        Transformationa44601-20        The symbol of Acererak is burned into your flesha445 a curse that can only be removed with a remove curse spell or similar magic. Until the curse endsa445 your hit points can't be restored by magic.a44621-35        You grow larger as if affected by an enlarge/reduce spella445 except the effect lasts for 1 hour.a44636-50        You grow smaller as if affected by an enlarge/reduce spella445 except the effect lasts for 1 hour.a44651-70        You arrive at the destination wearing nothing but the amulet of the black skull. Everything else that you were wearing or carrying appears in a random unoccupied space within 100 feet of you.a44671-95        You are paralyzed for 1 minute or until this effect is ended with a lesser restoration spell or similar magic.a44696-00        You become petrified. This effect can be ended only with a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

Name: Amulet of the Planes
Description: While wearing this amulet  you can use an action to name a location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. Then make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a successful check  you cast the plane shift spell. On a failure  you and each creature and object within 15 feet of you travel to a random destination. Roll a d100. On a 1–60  you travel to a random location on the plane you named. On a 61–100  you travel to a randomly determined plane of existence.

Name: Holy Symbol of Ravenkind
Description: The Holy Symbol of Ravenkind is a unique holy symbol sacred to the good-hearted faithful of Barovia. It predates the establishment of any church in Barovia. According to legenda445 it was delivered to a paladin named Lugdana by a giant raven - or an angel in the form of a giant raven. Lugdana used the holy symbol to root out and destroy nests of vampires until her death. The high priests of Ravenloft kept and wore the holy symbol after Lugdana's passing.a446The holy symbol is a platinum amulet shaped like the suna445 with a large crystal embedded in its center.a446The holy symbol has 10 charges for the following properties. It regains 1d6 + 4 charges daily at dawn.a446Hold Vampires. As an Actiona445 you can expend 1 charge and present the holy symbol to make it flare with holy power. Vampires and vampire spawn within 30 feet of the holy symbol when it flares must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed savea445 a target is paralyzed for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end the effect on itself.a446Turn Undead. If you have the Turn Undead or the Turn the Unholy featurea445 you can expend 3 charges when you present the holy symbol while using that feature. When you do soa445 undead have disadvantage on their saving throws against the effect.a446Sunlight. As an actiona445 you can expend 5 charges while presenting the holy symbol to make it shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The light is sunlight and lasts for 10 minutes or until you end the effect (no action required).

Name: Scarab of Protection
Description: If you hold this beetle-shaped medallion in your hand for 1 rounda445 an inscription appears on its surface revealing its magical nature. It provides two benefits while it is on your person:a446You have advantage on saving throws against spells.a446The scarab has 12 charges. If you fail a saving throw against a necromancy spell or a harmful effect originating from an undead creaturea445 you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge and turn the failed save into a successful one. The scarab crumbles into powder and is destroyed when its last charge is expended.

Name: Cloak of Billowing
Description: While wearing this cloaka445 you can use a bonus action to make it billow dramatically.

Name: Cloak of Many Fashions
Description: While wearing this cloaka445 you can use a bonus action to change the stylea445 colora445 and apparent quality of the garment. The cloak's weight doesn't change. Regardless of its appearancea445 the cloak can't be anything but a cloak. Although it can duplicate the appearance of other magic cloaksa445 it doesn't gain their magical properties.

Name: Cloak of Elvenkind
Description: While you wear this cloak with its hood upa445 Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage. and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hidea445 as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

Name: Cloak of Protection
Description: You gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws while you wear this cloak

Name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
Description: While wearing this cloak with its hood upa445 you can breathe underwatera445 and you have a swimming speed of 60 feet. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

Name: Piwafwi (Cloak of Elvenkind)
Description: This dark spider-silk cloak is made by drow. It is a cloak of elvenkind. It loses its magic if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour without interruption.a446While you wear this cloak with its hood upa445 Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage. and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hidea445 as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

Name: Cloak of Displacement
Description: While you wear this cloaka445 it projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual locationa445 causing any creature to have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damagea445 the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while you are incapacitateda445 restraineda445 or otherwise unable to move.

Name: Cloak of the Bat
Description: While wearing this cloaka445 you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. In an area of dim light or darknessa445 you can grip the edges of the cloak with both hands and use it to fly at a speed of 40 feet. If you ever fail to grip the cloak's edges while flying in this waya445 or if you are no longer in dim light or darknessa445 you lose this flying speed.a446While wearing the cloak in an area of dim light or darknessa445 you can use your action to cast polymorph on yourselfa445 transforming into a bat. While you are in the form of the bata445 you retain your Intelligencea445 Wisdoma445 and Charisma scores. The cloak can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Name: Hell Hound Cloak
Description: This dark cloak is made of cured hell hound hide. As an actiona445 you can command the cloak to transform you into a hell hound for up to 1 hour. The transformation otherwise functions as the polymorph spella445 but you can use a bonus action to revert to your normal form.a446Curse. This cloak is cursed with the essence of a hell hounda445 and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. Until the curse is broken with remove curse or similar magica445 you are unwilling to part with the cloaka445 keeping it within reach at all times.a446The sixth time you use the cloaka445 and each time thereaftera445 you must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed savea445 the transformation lasts until dispelled or until you drop to 0 hit pointsa445 and you can't willingly return to normal form. If you ever remain in hell hound form for 6 hoursa445 the transformation becomes permanent and you lose your sense of self. All your statistics are then replaced by those of a hell hound. Thereaftera445 only remove curse or similar magic allows you to regain your identity and return to normal. If you remain in this permanent form for 6 daysa445 only a wish spell can reverse the transformation.

Name: Mantle of Spell Resistance
Description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells while you wear this cloak.

Name: Piwafwi of Fire Resistance
Description: This dark spider-silk cloak is made by drow. It is a cloak of elvenkind. It also grants resistance to fire damage while you wear it. It loses its magic if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour without interruption.a446While you wear this cloak with its hood upa445 Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage. and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hidea445 as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

Name: Wings of Flying
Description: While wearing this cloaka445 you can use an action to speak its command word. This turns the cloak into a pair of bat wings or bird wings on your back for 1 hour or until you repeat the command word as an action. The wings give you a flying speed of 60 feet. When they disappeara445 you can't use them again for 1d12 hours.

Name: Cloak of Arachnida
Description: This fine garment is made of black silk interwoven with faint silvery threads. While wearing ita445 you gain the following benefits:a446You have resistance to poison damage.a446You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.a446You can move upa445 downa445 and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilingsa445 while leaving your hands free.a446You can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain.a446You can use an action to cast the web spell (save DC 13). The web created by the spell fills twice its normal area. Once useda445 this property of the cloak can't be used again until the next dawn.

Name: Cloak of Invisibility
Description: While wearing this cloaka445 you can pull its hood over your head to cause yourself to become invisible. While you are invisiblea445 anything you are carrying or wearing is invisible with you. You become visible when you cease wearing the hood. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.a446Deduct the time you are invisiblea445 in increments of 1 minutea445 from the cloak's maximum duration of 2 hours. After 2 hours of usea445 the cloak ceases to function. For every uninterrupted period of 12 hours the cloak goes unuseda445 it regains 1 hour of duration.

Name: Bracers of Archery
Description: While wearing these bracers  you have proficiency with the longbow and shortbow  and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with such weapons.

Name: Bracer of Flying Daggers
Description: This armband appears to have thin daggers strapped to it. As an actiona445 you can pull up to two magic daggers from the bracer and immediately hurl thema445 making a ranged attack with each dagger. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right awaya445 and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

Name: Bracers of Defense
Description: While wearing these bracers  you gain a +2 bonus to AC if you are wearing no armor and using no shield.

Name: Bracelet of Rock Magic
Description: While you wear this gold braceleta445 it grants you immunity to being petrifieda445 and it allows you to cast flesh to stone (save DC 15) as an action. Once the spell has been cast three timesa445 the bracelet can no longer cast it. Thereaftera445 you can cast stone shape as an action. After you have done this thirteen timesa445 the bracelet loses its magic and turns from gold to lead.a446Curse. The bracelet's affinity with earth manifests as an unusual curse. Creatures of flesh that are strongly related to earth and stonea445 such as stone giants and dwarvesa445 have advantage on the saving throw against flesh to stone cast from the bracelet. If such a creature's save is successfula445 the bracelet breaks your attunement to it and casts the spell on you. You make your saving throw with disadvantagea445 and on a failed save you are petrified instantly.

Name: Illusionist’s Bracers
Description: A powerful illusionist of House Dimir originally developed these bracersa445 which enabled her to create multiple minor illusions at once. The bracers' powera445 thougha445 extends far beyond illusions.a446While wearing the bracersa445 whenever you cast a cantripa445 you can use a bonus action on the same turn to cast that cantrip a second time.

Name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
Description: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is already 19 or higher without them.

Name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
Description: These gloves seem to almost meld into your hands when you don them. When a ranged weapon attack hits you while you're wearing thema445 you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifiera445 provided that you have a free hand. If you reduce the damage to 0a445 you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in that hand.

Name: Gloves of Climbing and Swimming
Description: While wearing these glovesa445 climbing and swimming don't cost you extra movementa445 and you gain a +5 bonus to Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb or swim.

Name: Gloves of Thievery
Description: These gloves are invisible while worn. While wearing thema445 you gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks and Dexterity checks made to pick locks.

Name: Claws of the Umber Hulk
Description: These heavy gauntlets of brown iron are forged in the shape of an umber hulk's clawsa445 and they fit the wearer's hands and forearms all the way up to the elbow. While wearing both clawsa445 you gain a burrowing speed of 20 feeta445 and you can tunnel through solid rock at a rate of 1 foot per round.a446You can use a claw as a melee weapon while wearing it. You have proficiency with ita445 and it deals 1d8 slashing damage on a hit (your Strength modifier applies to the attack and damage rollsa445 as normal).a446While wearing the clawsa445 you can't manipulate objects or cast spells with somatic components.

Name: Clothes of Mending
Description: This elegant outfit of traveler's clothes magically mends itself to counteract daily wear and tear. Pieces of the outfit that are destroyed can't be repaired in this way.

Name: Mizzium Apparatus
Description: Innovation is a dangerous pursuita445 at least the way the mages of the Izzet League engage in it. As protection against the risk of an experiment going awrya445 they have developed a device to help channel and control their magic. This apparatus is a collection of leather strapsa445 flexible tubinga445 glass cylindersa445 and platesa445 bracersa445 and fittings made from a magic-infused metal alloy called mizziuma445 all assembled into a harness. The item weighs 8 pounds.a446While you are wearing the mizzium apparatusa445 you can use it as an arcane focus. In additiona445 you can attempt to cast a spell that you do not know or have prepared. The spell you choose must be on your class's spell list and of a level for which you have a spell slota445 and you must provide the spell's components.a446You expend a spell slot to cast the spell as normala445 but before resolving it you must make an Intelligence (Arcana) check. The DC is 10 + twice the level of the spell slot you expend to cast the spell.a446On a successful checka445 you cast the spell as normala445 using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier. On a failed checka445 you cast a different spell from the one you intended. Randomly determine the spell you cast by rolling on the table for the level of the spell slot you expended. If the slot is 6th level or highera445 roll on the table for 5th-level spells.a446If you try to cast a cantrip you don't knowa445 the DC for the Intelligence (Arcana) check is 10a445 and on a failed checka445 there is no effect.a4461st-Level Spellsa446d6        spella4461        burning handsa4462        chaos bolta4463        color spraya4464        faerie firea4465        fog clouda4466        thunderwavea4462nd-Level Spellsa446d6        spella4461        blura4462        gust of winda4463        heat metala4464        Melf's acid arrowa4465        scorching raya4466        shattera4463rd-Level Spellsa446d6        spella4461        feara4462        feign deatha4463        fireballa4464        gaseous forma4465        sleet storma4466        stinking clouda4464th-Level Spellsa446d4        spella4461        confusiona4462        conjure minor elementalsa4463        Evard's black tentaclesa4464        ice storma4465th-Level Spellsa446d4        spella4461        animate objectsa4462        cloudkilla4463        cone of colda4464        flame strike

Name: Robe of Serpents
Description: A robe of serpents is a stylish silk garment that is popular among wealthy nobles and retired assassins. The robe is emblazoned with 1d4 + 3 stylized serpentsa445 all brightly colored.a446As a bonus action on your turna445 you can transform one of the robe's serpents into a giant poisonous snake. The snake instantly falls from the robea445 slithers into an unoccupied space next to youa445 and acts on your initiative count. The snake can tell friendly creatures from hostile ones and attacks the latter. The snake disappears in a harmless puff of smoke after 1 houra445 when it drops to 0 hit pointsa445 or when you dismiss it (no action required). Once detacheda445 a snake can't return to the robe. When all of the robe's snakes have detacheda445 the robe becomes a nonmagical garment.

Name: Wingwear
Description: This snug uniform has symbols of air stitched into it and leathery flaps that stretch along the armsa445 waista445 and legs to create wings for gliding. A suit of wingwear has 3 charges. While you wear the suita445 you can use a bonus action and expend 1 charge to gain a flying speed of 30 feet until you land. At the end of each of your turnsa445 your altitude drops by 5 feet. Your altitude drops instantly to 0 feet at the end of your turn if you didn't fly at least 30 feet horizontally on that turn. When your altitude drops to 0 feeta445 you land (or fall)a445 and you must expend another charge to use the suit again.a446The suit regains all of its expended charges after spending at least 1 hour in an elemental air node.

Name: Lord’s Ensemble
Description: The Masked Lords of Waterdeep don this ensemble when meeting with one another. This raiment renders each lord indistinguishable from the others. The ensemble consists of three pieces—a helma445 an amuleta445 and a robe—that function as a single magic item when worn togethera445 but only within the city of Waterdeep and its sewers. You become attuned to the ensemble as a single item.a446Lord's Helm. This bucket helm covers your head and conceals your face. Screens over the eyes help to shroud your identity without blinding you. While you wear the helma445 your voice is magically altered to sound genderlessa445 and you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughtsa445 to determine whether you are lyinga445 to know your alignmenta445 or to know your creature type. Creatures can communicate telepathically with you only if you allow it.a446Lord's Amulet. This amulet bears the crest of Waterdeep. It functions as an amulet of proof against detection and location.a446Lord's Robe. This elegant robe functions as a ring of free actiona445 and it creates the illusion that you have a nondescripta445 androgynous humanoid build and stand 6 feet tall.

Name: Robe of Eyes
Description: This robe is adorned with eyelike patterns. While you wear the robea445 you gain the following benefits:a446The robe lets you see in all directionsa445 and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.a446You have darkvision out to a range of 120 feet.a446You can see invisible creatures and objectsa445 as well as see into the Ethereal Planea445 out to a range of 120 feet.a446The eyes on the robe can't be closed or averted. Although you can close or avert your own eyesa445 you are never considered to be doing so while wearing this robe.a446A light spell cast on the robe or a daylight spell cast within 5 feet of the robe causes you to be blinded for 1 minute. At the end of each of your turnsa445 you can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 11 for light or DC 15 for daylight)a445 ending the blindness on a success.

Name: Robe of Summer
Description: This elegant garment is made from fine cloth in hues of reda445 orangea445 and gold. While you wear the robea445 you have resistance to cold damage. In additiona445 you are comfortable as if the temperature were that of a balmy daya445 so you suffer no ill effects from the weather's temperature extremes.

Name: Robe of Scintillating Colours
Description: This robe has 3 chargesa445 and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While you wear ita445 you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cause the garment to display a shifting pattern of dazzling hues until the end of your next turn. During this timea445 the robe sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Creatures that can see you have disadvantage on attack rolls against you. In additiona445 any creature in the bright light that can see you when the robe's power is activated must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become stunned until the effect ends.

Name: Robe of Stars
Description: This black or dark blue robe is embroidered with small white or silver stars. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws while you wear it.a446Six starsa445 located on the robe's upper front portiona445 are particularly large. While wearing this robea445 you can use an action to pull off one of the stars and use it to cast magic missile as a 5th-level spell. Daily at duska445 1d6 removed stars reappear on the robe.a446While you wear the robea445 you can use an action to enter the Astral Plane along with everything you are wearing and carrying. You remain there until you use an action to return to the plane you were on. You reappear in the last space you occupieda445 or if that space is occupieda445 the nearest unoccupied space.

Name: Robe of the Archmagi
Description: This elegant garment is made from exquisite cloth of whitea445 graya445 or black and adorned with silvery runes. The robe's color corresponds to the alignment for which the item was created. A white robe was made for gooda445 gray for neutrala445 and black for evil. You can't attune to a robe of the archmagi that doesn't correspond to your alignment.a446You gain these benefits while wearing the robe:a446If you aren't wearing armora445 your base Armor Class is 15 + your Dexterity modifier.a446You have advantage on saving throws against spell and other magical effects.a446Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by 2.

Name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
Description: While wearing this belt  you gain the following benefits:a446Your Constitution score increases by 2  to a maximum of 20.a446You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with dwarves.a446In addition  while attuned to the belt  you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of growing a full beard if you’re capable of growing one  or a visibly thicker beard if you already have one.a446If you aren’t a dwarf  you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:a446You have advantage on saving throws against poison  and you have resistance against poison damage.a446You have darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.a446You can speak  read  and write Dwarvish.

Name: Belt of Giant’s Strength (Hill)
Description: While wearing this belt  your Strength score changes to 21. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the belt’s score  the item has no effect on you.

Name: Belt of Giant’s Strength (Stone/Frost)
Description: While wearing this belt  your Strength score changes to 23. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the belt’s score  the item has no effect on you.

Name: Belt of Giant’s Strength (Fire)
Description: While wearing this belt  your Strength score changes to 25. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the belt’s score  the item has no effect on you.

Name: Belt of Giant’s Strength (Cloud)
Description: While wearing this belt  your Strength score changes to 27. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the belt’s score  the item has no effect on you.

Name: Belt of Giant’s Strength (Storm)
Description: While wearing this belt  your Strength score changes to 29. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the belt’s score  the item has no effect on you.

Name: Boots of False Tracks
Description: Only humanoids can wear these boots. While wearing the bootsa445 you can choose to have them leave tracks like those of another kind of humanoid of your size.

Name: Boots of Elvenkind
Description: While you wear these boots  your steps make no sound  regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently.

Name: Boots of Striding and Springing
Description: While you wear these boots  your walking speed becomes 30 feet  unless your walking speed is higher  and your speed isn’t reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor. In addition  you can jump three times the normal distance  though you can’t jump farther than your remaining movement would allow.

Name: Boots of the Winterlands
Description: These furred boots are snug and feel quite warm. While you wear them  you gain the following benefits:a446You have resistance to cold damage.a446You ignore difficult terrain created by ice or snow.a446You can tolerate temperatures as low as −50 degrees Fahrenheit without any additional protection. If you wear heavy clothes  you can tolerate temperatures as low as −100 degrees Fahrenheit.

Name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
Description: While you wear these light shoesa445 you can move upa445 downa445 and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilingsa445 while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. Howevera445 the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surfacea445 such as one covered by ice or oil.

Name: Winged Boots
Description: While you wear these bootsa445 you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can use the boots to fly for up to 4 hoursa445 all at once or in several shorter flightsa445 each one using a minimum of 1 minute from the duration. If you are flying when the duration expiresa445 you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.a446The boots regain 2 hours of flying capability for every 12 hours they aren't in use.

Name: Boots of Levitation
Description: While you wear these boots  you can use an action to cast the levitate spell on yourself at will.

Name: Boots of Speed
Description: While you wear these boots  you can use a bonus action and click the boots’ heels together. If you do  the boots double your walking speed  and any creature that makes an opportunity attack against you has disadvantage on the attack roll. If you click your heels together again  you end the effect. When the boots’ property has been used for a total of 10 minutes  the magic ceases to function until you finish a long rest.

Name: Bead of Nourishment
Description: This spongya445 flavorlessa445 gelatinous bead dissolves on your tongue and provides as much nourishment as 1 day of rations.

Name: Bead of Refreshment
Description: This spongya445 flavorlessa445 gelatinous bead dissolves in liquida445 transforming up to a pint of the liquid into fresha445 cold drinking water. The bead has no effect on magical liquids or harmful substances such as poison.

Name: Candle of the Deep
Description: The flame of this candle is not extinguished when immersed in water. It gives off light and heat like a normal candle.

Name: Charlatan’s Die
Description: Whenever you roll this six—sided diea445 you can control which number it rolls.

Name: Ear Horn of Hearing
Description: While held up to your eara445 this horn suppresses the effects of the deafened condition on youa445 allowing you to hear normally.

Name: Enduring Spellbook
Description: This spellbooka445 along with anything written on its pagesa445 can't be damaged by fire or immersion in water. In additiona445 the spellbook doesn't deteriorate with age.

Name: Heward’s Handy Spice Pouch
Description: This belt pouch appears empty and has 10 charges. While holding the poucha445 you can use an action to expend 1 of its chargesa445 speak the name of any nonmagical food seasoning (such as salta445 peppera445 saffrona445 or cilantro)a445 and remove a pinch of the desired seasoning from the pouch. A pinch is enough to season a single meal. The pouch regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Horn of Silent Alarm
Description: This horn has 4 charges. When you use an action to blow ita445 one creature of your choice can hear the horns blarea445 provided the creature is within 600 feet of the horn and not deafened. No other creature hears sound coming from the horn. The horn regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Instrument of Illusions
Description: While you are playing this musical instrumenta445 you can create harmlessa445 illusory visual effects within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on the instrument. If you are a barda445 the radius increases to 15 feet. Sample visual effects include luminous musical notesa445 a spectral dancera445 butterfliesa445 and gently falling snow. The magical effects have neither substance nor sounda445 and they are obviously illusory. The effects end when you stop playing.a446If you have proficiency with a given musical instrumenta445 you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.a446A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focusa445 substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.a446Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.a446See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.a446Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.a446History. Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.a446Performance. Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.a446Compose a Tune. As part of a long resta445 you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.a446Musical Instrumenta446Activity        DCa446Identify a tune        10a446Improvise a tune        20

Name: Instrument of Scribing
Description: This musical instrument has 3 charges. While you are playing ita445 you can use an action to expend 1 charge from the instrument and write a magical message on a nonmagical object or surface that you can see within 30 feet of you. The message can be up to six words long and is written in a language you know. If you are a barda445 you can scribe an additional seven words and choose to make the message glow faintlya445 allowing it to be seen in nonmagical darkness. Casting dispel magic on the message erases it. Otherwisea445 the message fades away after 24 hours.a446The instrument regains all expended charges daily at dawn.a446If you have proficiency with a given musical instrumenta445 you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.a446A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focusa445 substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.a446Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.a446See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.a446Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.a446History. Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.a446Performance. Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.a446Compose a Tune. As part of a long resta445 you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.a446Musical Instrumenta446Activity        DCa446Identify a tune        10a446Improvise a tune        20

Name: Lock of Trickery
Description: This lock appears to be an ordinary lock (of the type described in chapter 5 of the Player's Handbook) and comes with a single key. The tumblers in this lock magically adjust to thwart burglars. Dexterity checks made to pick the lock have disadvantage.

Name: Moodmark Paint
Description: This thicka445 black paint is stored in a small jara445 containing enough paint to apply moodmarks to one creature. The paint is dabbed on the face in spots or markings that often resemble the eyes of insects or spiders. Applying the paint in this way takes 1 minute.a446For the next 8 hoursa445 the marks change to reflect your mental state. A creature that can see you and makes a successful DC 10 Wisdom (Insight) check can discern whether you are happya445 sada445 angrya445 disgusteda445 surpriseda445 or afraida445 as well as the main source of that emotion. For examplea445 you might communicate fear caused by a monster you just saw around the cornera445 grief at the loss of a frienda445 or happiness derived from pride in your performance in combat. A dark elf has advantage on this check.

Name: Mystery Key
Description: A question mark is worked into the head of this key. The key has a 5 percent chance of unlocking any lock into which it's inserted. Once it unlocks somethinga445 the key disappears.

Name: Orb of Direction
Description: While holding this orba445 you can use an action to determine which way is north. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

Name: Orb of Time
Description: While holding this orba445 you can use an action to determine whether it is morninga445 afternoona445 eveninga445 or nighttime outside. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

Name: Pipe of Smoke Monsters
Description: While smoking this pipea445 you can use an action to exhale a puff of smoke that takes the form of a single creaturea445 such as a dragona445 a flumpha445 or a froghemoth. The form must be small enough to fit in a 1-foot cube and loses its shape after a few secondsa445 becoming an ordinary puff of smoke.

Name: Pole of Angling
Description: While holding this 10-foot polea445 you can speak a command word and transform it into a fishing pole with a hooka445 a linea445 and a reel. Speaking the command word again changes the fishing pole back into a normal 10-foot pole.

Name: Pole of Collapsing
Description: While holding this 10-foot polea445 you can use an action to speak a command word and cause it to collapse into a 1-foot-long roda445 for ease of storage. The pole's weight doesn't change. You can use an action to speak a different command word and cause the rod to revert to a pole; howevera445 the rod will elongate only as far as the surrounding space allows.

Name: Pot of Awakening
Description: If you plant an ordinary shrub in this 10-pound clay pot and let it grow for 30 daysa445 the shrub magically transforms into an awakened shrub at the end of that time. When the shrub awakensa445 its roots break the pota445 destroying it.a446The awakened shrub is friendly toward you. Absent commands from youa445 it does nothing.

Name: Rope of Mending
Description: You can cut this 50-foot coil of hempen rope into any number of smaller piecesa445 and then use an action to speak a command word and cause the pieces to knit back together. The pieces must be in contact with each other and not otherwise in use. A rope of mending is forever shortened if a section of it is lost or destroyed.

Name: Ruby of the Warmage
Description: Etched with eldritch runesa445 this 1-inch-diameter ruby allows you to use a simple or martial weapon as a spellcasting focus for your spells. For this property to worka445 you must attach the ruby to the weapon by pressing the ruby against it for at least 10 minutes. Thereaftera445 the ruby can't be removed unless you detach it as an action or the weapon is destroyed. Not even an antimagic field causes it to fall off. The ruby does fall off the weapon if your attunement to the ruby ends.

Name: Talking Doll
Description: While this stuffed doll is within 5 feet of youa445 you can spend a short rest telling it to say up to six phrasesa445 none of which can be more than six words longa445 and set a condition under which the doll speaks each phrase. You can also replace old phrases with new ones. Whatever the conditiona445 it must occur within 5 feet of the doll to make it speak. For examplea445 whenever someone picks up the dolla445 it might saya445 I want a piece of candy. The doll's phrases are lost when your attunement to the doll ends.

Name: Tankard of Sobriety
Description: This tankard has a stern face sculpted into one side. You can drink alea445 winea445 or any other nonmagical alcoholic beverage poured into it without becoming inebriated. The tankard has no effect on magical liquids or harmful substances such as poison.

Name: Alchemy Jug
Description: This ceramic jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the jug when it is shakena445 even if the jug is empty.a446You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterwarda445 you can uncork the jug as an action and pour that liquid outa445 up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.a446Once the jug starts producing a liquida445 it can't produce a different onea445 or more of one that has reached its maximuma445 until the next dawn.a446Liquid        Max Amounta446Acid        8 ouncesa446Basic poison        ½ ouncea446Beer        4 gallonsa446Honey        1 gallona446Mayonnaise        2 gallonsa446Oil        1 quarta446Vinegar        2 gallonsa446Watera445 fresh        8 gallonsa446Watera445 salt        12 gallonsa446Wine        1 gallon

Name: Bag of Holding
Description: This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensionsa445 roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 poundsa445 not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 poundsa445 regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.a446If the bag is overloadeda445 pierceda445 or torna445 it ruptures and is destroyeda445 and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside outa445 its contents spill fortha445 unharmeda445 but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute)a445 after which time they begin to suffocate.a446Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a Heward's handy haversacka445 portable holea445 or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

Name: Bag of Tricks
Description: This ordinary bag  made from gray  rust  or tan cloth  appears empty. Reaching inside the bag  however  reveals the presence of a small  fuzzy object. The bag weighs 1/2 pound.a446You can use an action to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands  it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a d8 and consulting the table that corresponds to the bag’s color. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.a446The creature is friendly to you and your companions  and it acts on your turn. You can use a bonus action to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn  or to give it general orders  such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders  the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.a446Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag  the bag can’t be used again until the next dawn.a446Gray Bag of Tricksa446d8        Creaturea4461        Weasela4462        Giant rata4463        Badgera4464        Boara4465        Panthera4466        Giant badgera4467        Dire wolfa4468        Giant elka446Rust Bag of Tricksa446d8        Creaturea4461        Rata4462        Owla4463        Mastiffa4464        Goata4465        Giant goata4466        Giant boara4467        Liona4468        Brown beara446Tan Bag of Tricksa446d8        Creaturea4461        Jackala4462        Apea4463        Baboona4464        Axe beaka4465        Black beara4466        Giant weasela4467        Giant hyenaa4468        Tiger

Name: Balance of Harmony
Description: This scale bears celestial symbols on one pan and fiendish symbols on the other. You can use the scale to cast detect evil and good as a ritual. Doing so requires you to place the scale on a solid surfacea445 then sprinkle the pans with holy water or place a transparent gem worth 100 gp in each pan. The scale remains motionless if it detects nothinga445 tips to one side or the other for good (consecrated) or evil (desecrated)a445 and fluctuates slightly if it detects a creature appropriate to the spell but neither good nor evil. By touching the scales after casting the rituala445 you instantly learn any information the spell can normally conveya445 and then the effect ends.

Name: Balloon Pack
Description: This backpack contains the spirit of an air elemental and a compact leather balloon. While you're wearing the backpacka445 you can deploy the balloon as an action and gain the effect of the levitate spell for 10 minutesa445 targeting yourself and requiring no concentration. Alternativelya445 you can use a reaction to deploy the balloon when you're falling and gain the effect of the feather fall spell for yourself.a446When either spell endsa445 the balloon slowly deflates as the elemental spirit escapes and returns to the Elemental Plane of Air. As the balloon deflatesa445 you descend gently toward the ground for up to 60 feet. IF you are still in the air at the end of this distancea445 you fall if you have no other means of staying aloft.a446After the spirit departsa445 the backpack's property is unusable unless the backpack is recharged for 1 hour in an elemental air nodea445 which binds another spirit to the backpack.

Name: Broom of Flying
Description: This wooden brooma445 which weighs 3 poundsa445 functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 poundsa445 but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.a446You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command worda445 name the locationa445 and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command worda445 provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

Name: Decanter of Endless Water
Description: This stoppered flask sloshes when shakena445 as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.a446You can use an action to remove the stopper and speak one of three command wordsa445 whereupon an amount of fresh water or salt water (your choice) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following options:a446Stream produces 1 gallon of water.a446Fountain produces 5 gallons of water.a446Geyser produces 30 gallons of water that gushes forth in a geyser 30 feet long and 1 foot wide. As a bonus action while holding the decantera445 you can aim the geyser at a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or take 1d4 bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Instead of a creaturea445 you can target an object that isn't being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is either knocked over or pushed up to 15 feet away from you.

Name: Deck of Illusions
Description: This box contains a set of parchment cards. A full deck has 34 cards. A deck found as treasure is usually missing 1d20 - 1 cards.a446The magic of the deck functions only if cards are drawn at random (you can use an altered deck of playing cards to simulate the deck). You can use an action to draw a card at random from the deck and throw it to the ground at a point within 30 feet of you.a446An illusion of one or more creatures forms over the thrown card and remains until dispelled. An illusory creature appears reala445 of the appropriate sizea445 and behaves as if it were a real creaturea445 except that it can do no harm. While you are within 120 feet of the illusory creature and can see ita445 you can use an action to move it magically anywhere within 30 feet of its card. Any physical interaction with the illusory creature reveals it to be an illusiona445 because objects pass through it. Someone who uses an action to visually inspect the creature identifies it as illusory with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check. The creature then appears translucent.a446The illusion lasts until its card is moved or the illusion is dispelled. When the illusion endsa445 the image on its card disappearsa445 and that card can't be used again.a446Playing Card        Illusiona446Ace of hearts        Red dragona446King of hearts        Knight and four guardsa446Queen of hearts        Succubus/Incubusa446Jack of hearts        Druida446Ten of hearts        Cloud gianta446Nine of hearts        Ettina446Eight of hearts        Bugbeara446Two of hearts        Goblina446Ace of diamonds        Beholdera446King of diamonds        Archmage and mage apprenticea446Queen of diamonds        Night haga446Jack of diamonds        Assassina446Ten of diamonds        Fire gianta446Nine of diamonds        Ogre magea446Eight of diamonds        Gnolla446Two of diamonds        Kobolda446Ace of spades        Licha446King of spades        Priest and two acolytesa446Queen of spades        Medusaa446Jack of spades        Veterana446Ten of spades        Frost gianta446Nine of spades        Trolla446Eight of spades        Hobgoblina446Two of spades        Goblina446Ace of clubs        Iron golema446King of clubs        Bandit captain and three banditsa446Queen of clubs        Erinyesa446Jack of clubs        Berserkera446Ten of clubs        Hill gianta446Nine of clubs        Ogrea446Eight of clubs        Orca446Two of clubs        Kobolda446jokers (2)        You (the deck's owner)

Name: Driftglobe
Description: This small sphere of thick glass weighs 1 pound. If you are within 60 feet of ita445 you can speak its command word and cause it to emanate the light or daylight spell. Once useda445 the daylight effect can't be used again until the next dawn.a446You can speak another command word as an action to make the illuminated globe rise into the air and float no more than 5 feet off the ground. The globe hovers in this way until you or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 60 feet from the hovering globea445 it follows you until it is within 60 feet of you. It takes the shortest route to do so. If prevented from movinga445 the globe sinks gently to the ground and becomes inactivea445 and its light winks out.

Name: Dust of Disappearance
Description: Found in a small packeta445 this powder resembles very fine sand. There is enough of it for one use. When you use an action to throw the dust into the aira445 you and each creature and object within 10 feet of you become invisible for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all subjectsa445 and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect. If a creature affected by the dust attacks or casts a spella445 the invisibility ends for that creature.

Name: Dust of Sneezing and Choking
Description: Found in a small containera445 this powder resembles very fine sand. It appears to be dust of disappearancea445 and an identify spell reveals it to be such. There is enough of it for one use.a446When you use an action to throw a handful of the dust into the aira445 you and each creature that needs to breathe within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become unable to breathe while sneezing uncontrollably. A creature affected in this way is incapacitated and suffocating. As long as it is consciousa445 a creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turnsa445 ending the effect on it on a success. The lesser restoration spell can also end the effect on a creature.

Name: Elemental Gem
Description: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you use an action to break the gema445 an aira445 watera445 firea445 or earth elemental is summoned as if you had cast the conjure elemental spella445 and the gem's magic is lost.a446Multiple variations of this item exista445 as listed below:a446Elemental Gema445 Blue Sapphirea446Elemental Gema445 Emeralda446Elemental Gema445 Red Corunduma446Elemental Gema445 Yellow Diamond

Name: Eversmoking Bottle
Description: Smoke leaks from the lead-stoppered mouth of this brass bottlea445 which weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to remove the stoppera445 a cloud of thick smoke pours out in a 60-foot radius from the bottle. The cloud's area is heavily obscured. Each minute the bottle remains open and within the clouda445 the radius increases by 10 feet until it reaches its maximum radius of 120 feet.a446The cloud persists as long as the bottle is open. Closing the bottle requires you to speak its command word as an action. Once the bottle is closeda445 the cloud disperses after 10 minutes. A moderate wind (11 to 20 miles per hour) can also disperse the smoke after 1 minutea445 and a strong wind (21 or more miles per hour) can do so after 1 round.

Name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Silver Raven
Description: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of youa445 the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objectsa445 or if there isn't enough space for the creaturea445 the figurine doesn't become a creature.a446The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commandsa445 the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.a446The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the durationa445 the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine againa445 its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passeda445 as specified in the figurine's description.a446Silver Raven.a446This silver statuette of a raven can become a raven for up to 12 hours. Once it has been useda445 it can't be used again until 2 days have passed. While in raven forma445 the figurine allows you to cast the animal messenger spell on it at will.

Name: Gem of Brightness
Description: This prism has 50 charges. While you are holding ita445 you can use an action to speak one of three command words to cause one of the following effects:a446The first command word causes the gem to shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This effect doesn't expend a charge. It lasts until you use a bonus action to repeat the command word or until you use another function of the gem.a446The second command word expends 1 charge and causes the gem to fire a brilliant beam of light at one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become blinded for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turnsa445 ending the effect on itself on a success.a446The third command word expends 5 charges and causes the gem to flare with blinding light in a 30-foot cone originating from it. Each creature in the cone must make a saving throw as if struck by the beam created with the second command word.a446When all of the gem's charges are expendeda445 the gem becomes a nonmagical jewel worth 50 gp.

Name: Insignia of Claws
Description: The jewels in the insignia of the Cult of the Dragon flare with purple light when you enter combata445 empowering your natural fists or natural weapons.a446While wearing the insignia you gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical.

Name: Instrument of the Bard – Doss Lute
Description: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kinda445 superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exista445 each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d4 psychic damage.a446You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spella445 it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.a446You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be charmed on a failed saving throwa445 thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.a446All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: flya445 invisibilitya445 levitatea445 and protection from evil and good.a446In additiona445 the Doss lute can be used to cast animal friendshipa445 protection from energy (fire only)a445 and protection from poison.a446If you have proficiency with a given musical instrumenta445 you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.a446A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focusa445 substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.a446Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.a446See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.a446Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.a446History. Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.a446Performance. Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.a446Compose a Tune. As part of a long resta445 you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.a446Musical Instrumenta446Activity        DCa446Identify a tune        10a446Improvise a tune        20

Name: Instrument of the Bard – Fochulan Bandlore
Description: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kinda445 superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exista445 each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d4 psychic damage.a446You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spella445 it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.a446You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be charmed on a failed saving throwa445 thereby imposing disadvantage on the save.
