While it is within 1 mile of youa445 you can communicate with each other telepathically.a446When you use an action to speak the item's command word and place the keyrune on the ground in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of youa445 the keyrune transforms into a dire wolf. If there isn't enough space for the creaturea445 the keyrune doesn't transform.a446The creature is friendly to youa445 your companionsa445 and other members of your guild (unless those guild members are hostile to you). It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commandsa445 the creature takes the Dodge action and moves to avoid danger.a446At the end of the durationa445 the creature reverts to its keyrune form. It reverts early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature reverts to its keyrune forma445 it can't transform again until 36 hours have passed.

Name: Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals
Description: If the stone is touching the grounda445 you can use an action to speak its command word and summon an earth elementala445 as if you had cast the conjure elemental spell. The stone can't be used this way again until the next dawn. The stone weighs 5 pounds.

Name: Stonespeaker Crystal
Description: Created by the stone giant librarians of Gravenhollowa445 this nineteen-inch-long shard of quartz grants you advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks while it is on your person.a446The crystal has 10 charges. While holding ita445 you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it: speak with animals (2 charges)a445 speak with dead (4 charges)a445 or speak with plants (3 charges).a446When you cast a divination spella445 you can use the crystal in place of one material component that would normally be consumed by the spella445 at a cost of 1 charge per level of the spell. The crystal is not consumed when used in this way.a446The crystal regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the crystal's last chargea445 roll a d20. On a 1a445 the crystal vanishesa445 lost forever.

Name: Weird Tank
Description: A weird tank is a ten-gallon tank of blown glass and sculpted bronze with a backpack-like carrying harness fashioned from tough leather. A water weird is contained within the tank. While wearing the tanka445 you can use an action to open ita445 allowing the water weird to emerge. The water weird acts immediately after you in the initiative ordera445 and it is bound to the tank.a446You can command the water weird telepathically (no action required) while you wear the tank. You can close the tank as an action only if you have first commanded the water weird to retract into it or if the water weird is dead.a446If the water weird is killeda445 the tank loses its magical containment property until it spends at least 24 hours inside an elemental water node. When the tank is rechargeda445 a new water weird forms inside it.a446The tank has AC 15a445 50 hit pointsa445 vulnerability to bludgeoning damagea445 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing the tank to 0 hit points destroys it and the water weird contained within it.

Name: Bag of Devouring
Description: This bag superficially resembles a bag of holding but is a feeding orifice for a gigantic extradimensional creature. Turning the bag inside out closes the orifice.a446The extradimensional creature attached to the bag can sense whatever is placed inside the bag. Animal or vegetable matter placed wholly in the bag is devoured and lost forever. When part of a living creature is placed in the bag  as happens when someone reaches inside it  there is a 50 percent chance that the creature is pulled inside the bag. A creature inside the bag can use its action to try to escape with a successful DC 15 Strength check. Another creature can use its action to reach into the bag to pull a creature out  doing so with a successful DC 20 Strength check (provided it isn’t pulled inside the bag first). Any creature that starts its turn inside the bag is devoured  its body destroyed.a446Inanimate objects can be stored in the bag  which can hold a cubic foot of such material. However  once each day  the bag swallows any objects inside it and spits them out into another plane of existence. The GM determines the time and plane.a446If the bag is pierced or torn  it is destroyed  and anything contained within it is transported to a random location on the Astral Plane.

Name: Candle of Invocation
Description: This slender taper is dedicated to a deity and shares that deity's alignment. The candle's alignment can be detected with the detect evil and good spell. The DM chooses the god and associated alignment or determines the alignment randomly.a446d20        Alignmenta4461-2        Chaotic evila4463-4        Chaotic neutrala4465-7        Chaotic gooda4468-9        Neutral evila44610-11        Neutrala44612-13        Neutral gooda44614-15        Lawful evila44616-17        Lawful neutrala44618-20        Lawful gooda446The candle's magic is activated when the candle is lita445 which requires an action. After burning for 4 hoursa445 the candle is destroyed. You can snuff it out early for use at a later time. Deduct the time it burned in increments of 1 minute from the candle's total burn time.a446While lita445 the candle sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius. Any creature within that light whose alignment matches that of the candle makes attack rollsa445 saving throwsa445 and ability checks with advantage. In additiona445 a cleric or druid in the light whose alignment matches the candle's can cast 1st-level spells he or she has prepared without expending spell slotsa445 though the spell's effect is as if cast with a 1st-level slot.a446Alternativelya445 when you light the candle for the first timea445 you can cast the gate spell with it. Doing so destroys the candle.

Name: Carpet of Flying
Description: You can speak the carpet's command word as an action to make the carpet hover and fly. It moves according to your spoken directionsa445 provided that you are within 30 feet of it.a446Multiple variations of this item exista445 as listed below:a446Carpet of Flyinga445 3 ft. × 5 ft.a446Carpet of Flyinga445 4 ft. × 6 ft.a446Carpet of Flyinga445 5 ft. × 7 ft.a446Carpet of Flyinga445 6 ft. × 9 ft.

Name: Conch of Teleportation
Description: This item is an ordinarya445 albeit rather largea445 conch shell that has been inscribed with the uvar rune. The conch measures 2½ feet long and weighs 20 pounds.a446As an actiona445 you can cast the teleport spell by blowing into the shell. The destination is fixeda445 and there is no chance of either a mishap or the spell being off target. Anyone teleported by the conch appears in a specific location designated by the item's creator at the time the uvar rune is inscribed on the conch. It doesn't allow teleportation to any other destination. Once its spell is casta445 the conch can't be used again until the next dawn.

Name: Crystal Ball
Description: This crystal ball is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching ita445 you can cast the scrying spell (save DC 17) with it.

Name: Devastation Orb (Air)
Description: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an elemental weapon. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For examplea445 an air node creates a devastation orb of air. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2a445000 gp worth of special componentsa445 which are consumed.a446A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diametera445 weighs 10 poundsa445 and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates 1d100 hours after its creationa445 releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as identify and divination can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10a445 15 hit pointsa445 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.a446A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For examplea445 a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a devastation orb of air and keep it from detonating. While in the containera445 the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonatea445 it explodes 1d6 rounds latera445 unless it is returned to the container.a446Regardless of the type of orba445 its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.a446Air Orb. When this orb detonatesa445 it creates a powerful windstorm that lasts for 1 hour. Whenever a creature ends its turn exposed to the winda445 the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 bludgeoning damagea445 as the wind and debris batter it. The wind is strong enough to uproot weak trees and destroy light structures after at least 10 minutes of exposure. Otherwisea445 the rules for strong wind applya445 as detailed in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

Name: Devastation Orb (Earth)
Description: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an elemental weapon. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For examplea445 an air node creates a devastation orb of air. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2a445000 gp worth of special componentsa445 which are consumed.a446A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diametera445 weighs 10 poundsa445 and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates 1d100 hours after its creationa445 releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as identify and divination can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10a445 15 hit pointsa445 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.a446A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For examplea445 a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a devastation orb of air and keep it from detonating. While in the containera445 the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonatea445 it explodes 1d6 rounds latera445 unless it is returned to the container.a446Regardless of the type of orba445 its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.a446Earth Orb. When this orb detonatesa445 it subjects the area to the effects of the earthquake spell for 1 minute (spell save DC 18). For the purpose of the spell's effectsa445 the spell is cast on the turn that the orb explodes.

Name: Devastation Orb (Fire)
Description: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an elemental weapon. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For examplea445 an air node creates a devastation orb of air. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2a445000 gp worth of special componentsa445 which are consumed.a446A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diametera445 weighs 10 poundsa445 and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates 1d100 hours after its creationa445 releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as identify and divination can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10a445 15 hit pointsa445 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.a446A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For examplea445 a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a devastation orb of air and keep it from detonating. While in the containera445 the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonatea445 it explodes 1d6 rounds latera445 unless it is returned to the container.a446Regardless of the type of orba445 its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.a446Fire Orb. When this orb detonatesa445 it creates a dry heat wave that lasts for 24 hours. Within the area of effecta445 the rules for extreme heat applya445 as detailed in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. At the end of each houra445 there is a ten percent chance that the heat wave starts a wildfire in a random location within the area of effect. The wildfire covers a 10-foot-square area initially but expands to fill another 10-foot square each round until the fire is extinguished or burns itself out. A creature that comes within 10 feet of a wildfire for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 3d6 fire damage.

Name: Devastation Orb (Water)
Description: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an elemental weapon. The type of orb created depends on the node used. For examplea445 an air node creates a devastation orb of air. The ritual takes 1 hour to complete and requires 2a445000 gp worth of special componentsa445 which are consumed.a446A devastation orb measures 12 inches in diametera445 weighs 10 poundsa445 and has a solid outer shell. The orb detonates 1d100 hours after its creationa445 releasing the elemental energy it contains. The orb gives no outward sign of how much time remains before it will detonate. Spells such as identify and divination can be used to ascertain when the orb will explode. An orb has AC 10a445 15 hit pointsa445 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing it to 0 hit points causes it to explode instantly.a446A special container can be crafted to contain a devastation orb and prevent it from detonating. The container must be inscribed with symbols of the orb's opposing element. For examplea445 a case inscribed with earth symbols can be used to contain a devastation orb of air and keep it from detonating. While in the containera445 the orb thrums. If it is removed from the container after the time when it was supposed to detonatea445 it explodes 1d6 rounds latera445 unless it is returned to the container.a446Regardless of the type of orba445 its effect is contained within a sphere with a 1 mile radius. The orb is the sphere's point of origin. The orb is destroyed after one use.a446Water Orb. When this orb detonatesa445 it creates a torrential rainstorm that lasts for 24 hours. Within the area of effecta445 the rules for heavy precipitation applya445 as detailed in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. If there is a substantial body of water in the areaa445 it floods after 2d10 hours of heavy raina445 rising 10 feet above its banks and inundating the surrounding area. The flood advances at a rate of 100 feet per rounda445 moving away from the body of water where it began until it reaches the edge of the area of effect: at that pointa445 the water flows downhill (and possibly recedes back to its origin). Light structures collapse and wash away. Any Large or smaller creature caught in the flood's path is swept away. The flooding destroys crops and might trigger mudslidesa445 depending on the terrain.

Name: Dimir Keyrune
Description: This keyrunea445 carved from black stone accented with steela445 resembles a stylized horror. On commanda445 it transforms into an intellect devourer that resembles the Dimir guild symbola445 with six bladelike legs. The creature exists for up to 24 hours. During that timea445 it pursues only a single mission you give it—usually an assignment to take over someone's bodya445 either to impersonate that person for a brief time or to extract secrets from their mind. When the mission is completea445 the creature returns to youa445 reports its successa445 and reverts to its keyrune form.a446When you use an action to speak the item's command word and place the keyrune on the ground in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of youa445 the keyrune transforms into a intellect devourer. If there isn't enough space for the creaturea445 the keyrune doesn't transform.a446The creature is friendly to youa445 your companionsa445 and other members of your guild (unless those guild members are hostile to you). It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commandsa445 the creature takes the Dodge action and moves to avoid danger.a446At the end of the durationa445 the creature reverts to its keyrune form. It reverts early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature reverts to its keyrune forma445 it can't transform again until 36 hours have passed.

Name: Efreeti Bottle
Description: This painted brass bottle weighs 1 pound. When you use an action to remove the stoppera445 a cloud of thick smoke flows out of the bottle. At the end of your turna445 the smoke disappears with a flash of harmless firea445 and an efreeti appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.a446The first time the bottle is openeda445 the DM rolls to determine what happens.a446d100        Effecta44601-10        The efreeti attacks you. After fighting for 5 roundsa445 the efreeti disappearsa445 and the bottle loses its magic.a44611-90        The efreeti serves you for 1 houra445 doing as you command. Then the efreeti returns to the bottlea445 and a new stopper contains it. The stopper can't be removed for 24 hours. The next two times the bottle is openeda445 the same effect occurs. If the bottle is opened a fourth timea445 the efreeti escapes and disappearsa445 and the bottle loses its magic.a44691-00        The efreeti can cast the wish spell three times for you. It disappears when it grants the final wish or after 1 houra445 and the bottle loses its magic.

Name: Figurine of Wondrous Power: Obsidian Steed
Description: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of youa445 the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objectsa445 or if there isn't enough space for the creaturea445 the figurine doesn't become a creature.a446The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commandsa445 the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.a446The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the durationa445 the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine againa445 its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passeda445 as specified in the figurine's description.a446Obsidian Steed.a446This polished obsidian horse can become a nightmare for up to 24 hours. The nightmare fights only to defend itself. Once it has been useda445 it can't be used again until 5 days have passed.a446If you have a good alignmenta445 the figurine has a 10 percent chance each time you use it to ignore your ordersa445 including a command to revert to figurine form. If you mount the nightmare while it is ignoring your ordersa445 you and the nightmare are instantly transported to a random location on the plane of Hadesa445 where the nightmare reverts to figurine form.

Name: Golgari Keyrune
Description: Made from deep green jade with black veinsa445 this keyrune has an insectile shape. It can transform into a giant scorpion for up to 6 hours. The scorpion has an Intelligence of 4 and can communicate with you telepathically while it is within 60 feet of youa445 though its messages are largely limited to describing the passage of potential prey.a446When you use an action to speak the item's command word and place the keyrune on the ground in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of youa445 the keyrune transforms into a giant scorpion. If there isn't enough space for the creaturea445 the keyrune doesn't transform.a446The creature is friendly to youa445 your companionsa445 and other members of your guild (unless those guild members are hostile to you). It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commandsa445 the creature takes the Dodge action and moves to avoid danger.a446At the end of the durationa445 the creature reverts to its keyrune form. It reverts early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature reverts to its keyrune forma445 it can't transform again until 36 hours have passed.

Name: Bronze Horn of Valhalla
Description: You can use an action to blow this horn. In responsea445 warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear within 60 feet of you. These spirits use the berserker statistics. They return to Ysgard after 1 hour or when they drop to 0 hit points. Once you use the horna445 it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.a446A bronze horn summons 4d4 + 4 berserkers. To use the bronze horna445 you must be proficient with medium armor.a446If you blow the horn without meeting its requirementa445 the summoned berserkers attack you. If you meet the requirementa445 they are friendly to you and your companions and follow your commands.

Name: Horseshoes of the Zephyr
Description: These iron horseshoes come in a set of four. While all four shoes are affixed to the hooves of a horse or similar creaturea445 they allow the creature to move normally while floating 4 inches above the ground. This effect means the creature can cross or stand above nonsolid or unstable surfacesa445 such as water or lava. The creature leaves no tracks and ignores difficult terrain. In additiona445 the creature can move at normal speed for up to 12 hours a day without suffering exhaustion from a forced march.

Name: Ingot of the Skold Rune
Description: This appears to be a simple ingot of iron orea445 about a foot long and a few inches across. Inspection of its surface reveals the fainta445 silvery outline of the skold (shield) rune. The ingot has the following propertiesa445 which work only while it's on your person.a446Runic Shield. You have a +1 bonus to AC.a446Shield Bond. As a bonus actiona445 choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet of youa445 other than yourself. Until the end of your next turna445 any damage the target takes is reduced to 1a445 but you take half the damage prevented in this way. The damage you take can't be reduced in any way. Once you use this propertya445 you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.a446Shield Ward. You can transfer the ingot's magic to a nonmagical item—a shield or a two-handed melee weapon-by tracing the skold rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the enda445 the ingot is destroyeda445 and the rune appears in silver on the chosen itema445 which gains a benefit based on its form:a446Shield. The shield is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. Its magic gives you a +1 bonus to ACa445 and the first time after each of your long rests that damage reduces you to 0 hit pointsa445 you are instead reduced to 1 hit point. You must be wielding the shield to gain these benefits.a446Weapon. The weapon is now an uncommon magic weapon. It grants you a +1 bonus to AC while you're holding it.

Name: Instrument of the Bard – Anstruth Harp
Description: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kinda445 superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exista445 each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d4 psychic damage.a446You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spella445 it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.a446You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be charmed on a failed saving throwa445 thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.a446All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: flya445 invisibilitya445 levitatea445 and protection from evil and good.a446In additiona445 the Anstruth harp can be used to cast control weathera445 cure wounds (5th level)a445 and wall of thorns.a446If you have proficiency with a given musical instrumenta445 you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.a446A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focusa445 substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.a446Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.a446See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.a446Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.a446History. Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.a446Performance. Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.a446Compose a Tune. As part of a long resta445 you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.a446Musical Instrumenta446Activity        DCa446Identify a tune        10a446Improvise a tune        20

Name: Manual of Bodily Health
Description: This book contains health and diet tipsa445 and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelinesa445 your Constitution score increases by 2a445 as does your maximum for that score. The manual then loses its magica445 but regains it in a century.

Name: Manual of Gainful Exercise
Description: This book describes fitness exercisesa445 and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelinesa445 your Strength score increases by 2a445 as does your maximum for that score. The manual then loses its magica445 but regains it in a century.

Name: Manual of Golems
Description: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a particular type of golem. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly. To decipher and use the manuala445 you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a manual of golems and attempts to read it takes 6d6 psychic damage.a446Multiple variations of this item exista445 as listed below:a446Manual of Clay Golemsa446Manual of Flesh Golemsa446Manual of Iron Golemsa446Manual of Stone Golems

Name: Manual of Quickness of Action
Description: This book contains coordination and balance exercisesa445 and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelinesa445 your Dexterity score increases by 2a445 as does your maximum for that score. The manual then loses its magica445 but regains it in a century.

Name: Mirror of Life Trapping
Description: When this 4-foot-tall mirror is viewed indirectlya445 its surface shows faint images of creatures. The mirror weighs 50 poundsa445 and it has AC 11a445 10 hit pointsa445 and vulnerability to bludgeoning damage. It shatters and is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.a446If the mirror is hanging on a vertical surface and you are within 5 feet of ita445 you can use an action to speak its command word and activate it. It remains activated until you use an action to speak the command word again.a446Any creature other than you that sees its reflection in the activated mirror while within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be trappeda445 along with anything it is wearing or carryinga445 in one of the mirror's twelve extradimensional cells. This saving throw is made with advantage if the creature knows the mirror's naturea445 and constructs succeed on the saving throw automatically.a446An extradimensional cell is an infinite expanse filled with thick fog that reduces visibility to 10 feet. Creatures trapped in the mirror's cells don't agea445 and they don't need to eata445 drinka445 or sleep. A creature trapped within a cell can escape using magic that permits planar travel. Otherwisea445 the creature is confined to the cell until freed.a446If the mirror traps a creature but its twelve extradimensional cells are already occupieda445 the mirror frees one trapped creature at random to accommodate the new prisoner. A freed creature appears in an unoccupied space within sight of the mirror but facing away from it. If the mirror is shattereda445 all creatures it contains are freed and appear in unoccupied spaces near it.a446While within 5 feet of the mirrora445 you can use an action to speak the name of one creature trapped in it or call out a particular cell by number. The creature named or contained in the named cell appears as an image on the mirror's surface. You and the creature can then communicate normally.a446In a similar waya445 you can use an action to speak a second command word and free one creature trapped in the mirror. The freed creature appearsa445 along with its possessionsa445 in the unoccupied space nearest to the mirror and facing away from it.

Name: Navigation Orb
Description: A navigation orb is a hollowa445 7-foot-diameter sphere of thina445 polished mithral with a large skye (cloud) rune embossed on its outer surface. The orb levitates 10 feet above the ground and is keyed to a particular cloud castlea445 allowing you to control that castle's altitude and movement while the orb is inside the castle. If the orb is destroyed or removed from its castlea445 the castle's altitude and location remain fixed until the orb is returned or replaced.a446As an actiona445 you can cause one of the following effects to occur if you are touching the orb:a446The castle moves at a speed of 1 mph in a straight linea445 in a direction of your choicea445 until the castle stops or is made to stopa445 or until another action is used to change its direction. If this movement brings the castle into contact with the grounda445 the castle lands gently.a446The castlea445 if it is movinga445 comes to a gradual stop.a446The castle makes a slowa445 90-degree turn clockwise or counterclockwise (turning a northerly view into a westerly viewa445 for example). The castle can turn while it is moving in a straight line.a446Any creature touching the orb knows the altitude of the base of the castle above the ground or water below it.

Name: Nolzur’s Marvelous Pigments
Description: Typically found in 1d4 pots inside a fine wooden box with a brush (weighing 1 pound in total)a445 these pigments allow you to create three-dimensional objects by painting them in two dimensions. The paint flows from the brush to form the desired object as you concentrate on its image.a446Each pot of paint is sufficient to cover 1a445000 square feet of a surfacea445 which lets you create inanimate objects or terrain features—such as a doora445 a pita445 flowersa445 treesa445 cellsa445 roomsa445 or weapons—that are up to 10a445000 cubic feet. It takes 10 minutes to cover 100 square feet.a446When you complete the paintinga445 the object or terrain feature depicted becomes a reala445 nonmagical object. Thusa445 painting a door on a wall creates an actual door that can be opened to whatever is beyond. Painting a pit on a floor creates a real pita445 and its depth counts against the total area of objects you create.a446Nothing created by the pigments can have a value greater than 25 gp. If you paint an object of greater value (such as a diamond or a pile of gold)a445 the object looks authentica445 but close inspection reveals it is made from pastea445 bonea445 or some other worthless material.a446If you paint a form of energy such as fire or lightninga445 the energy appears but dissipates as soon as you complete the paintinga445 doing no harm to anything.

Name: Pennant of the Wind Rune
Description: This blue pennant is crafted from silk and is five feet long and whips about as if buffeted by a wind. The vind (wind) rune appears on its surfacea445 looking almost like a cloud. The pennant has the following propertiesa445 which work only while it's on your person.a446Wind Step. As an actiona445 you fly up to 20 feet. If you don't land at the end of this flighta445 you fall unless you have another means of staying aloft.a446Comforting Wind. You can't suffocate.a446Winds Grasp. As a reaction when you falla445 you can cause yourself to take no damage from the fall. Once you use this propertya445 you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.a446Wind Walker. While you are attuned to this runea445 you can cast levitate as a bonus action. Once you use this propertya445 you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.a446Gift of Wind. You can transfer the pennant's magic to a nonmagical item—a suit of armora445 a pair of bootsa445 or a cloak—by tracing the vind rune there with your finger. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the two items to be within 5 feet of each other. At the enda445 the pennant is destroyeda445 and the rune appears in silver on the chosen itema445 which gains a benefit based on its form:a446Armor. The armor is now an uncommon magic item that requires attunement. You gain a bonus to speed of 5 feet while you wear the armora445 and if it normally imposes disadvantage on Stealth checksa445 it no longer does so.a446Boots/Cloak. The pair of boots or cloak is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While wearing the itema445 you can convert up to 20 feet of your movement on each of your turns into flight. If you don't land at the end of this flighta445 you fall unless you have another means of staying aloft. You can also cast feather fall once from the itema445 and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

Name: Tome of Clear Thought
Description: This book contains memory and logic exercisesa445 and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelinesa445 your Intelligence score increases by 2a445 as does your maximum for that score. The manual then loses its magica445 but regains it in a century.

Name: Tome of Leadership and Influence
Description: This book contains guidelines for influencing and charming othersa445 and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelinesa445 your Charisma score increases by 2a445 as does your maximum for that score. The manual then loses its magica445 but regains it in a century.

Name: Tome of Understanding
Description: This book contains intuition and insight exercisesa445 and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelinesa445 your Wisdom score increases by 2a445 as does your maximum for that score. The manual then loses its magica445 but regains it in a century.

Name: Apparatus of Kwalish
Description: This item first appears to be a Large sealed iron barrel weighing 500 pounds. The barrel has a hidden catch  which can be found with a successful DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check. Releasing the catch unlocks a hatch at one end of the barrel  allowing two Medium or smaller creatures to crawl inside. Ten levers are set in a row at the far end  each in a neutral position  able to move either up or down. When certain levers are used  the apparatus transforms to resemble a giant lobster.a446The apparatus of the Crab is a Large object with the following statistics:a446Armor Class: 20a446Hit Points: 200a446Speed: 30 ft.  swim 30 ft. (or 0 ft. for both if the legs and tail aren’t extended)a446Damage Immunities: poison  psychica446To be used as a vehicle  the apparatus requires one pilot. While the apparatus’s hatch is closed  the compartment is airtight and watertight. The compartment holds enough air for 10 hours of breathing  divided by the number of breathing creatures inside.a446The apparatus floats on water. It can also go underwater to a depth of 900 feet. Below that  the vehicle takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage per minute from pressure.a446A creature in the compartment can use an action to move as many as two of the apparatus’s levers up or down. After each use  a lever goes back to its neutral position. Each lever  from left to right  functions as shown in the Apparatus of the Crab Levers table.a446Apparatus of the Crab Leversa446Lever        Up        Downa4461        Legs and tail extenda446allowing the apparatus toa446walk and swim.a446Legs and tail retracta446reducing the apparatusa445sa446speed to 0 and making ita446unable to benefit froma446bonuses to speed.a4462        Forward window shuttera446opens.        Forward window shuttera446closes.a4463        Side window shuttersa446open (two per side).        Side window shuttersa446close (two per side).a4464        Two claws extend froma446the front sides of thea446apparatus.        The claws retract.a4465        Each extended clawa446makes the followinga446melee weapon attack: +8a446to hit  reach 5 ft.  onea446target. Hit: 7 (2d6)a446bludgeoning damage.        Each extended clawa446makes the followinga446melee weapon attack: +8a446to hit  reach 5 ft.  onea446target. Hit: The target isa446grappled (escape DC 15).a4466        The apparatus walks ora446swims forward.        The apparatus walks ora446swims backwards.a4467        The apparatus turns 90a446degrees left.        The apparatus turns 90a446degrees right.a4468        Eyelike fixtures emita446bright light in a 30-foota446radius and dim light fora446an additional 30 feet.        The light turns off.a4469        The apparatus sinks asa446much as 20 feet in liquid.        The apparatus rises upa446to 20 feet in liquid.a44610        The rear hatch unsealsa446and opens.        The rear hatch closesa446and seals.

Name: Cubic Gate
Description: This cube is 3 inches across and radiates palpable magical energy. The six sides of the cube are each keyed to a different plane of existencea445 one of which is the Material Plane. The other sides are linked to planes determined by the DM.a446You can use an action to press one side of the cube to cast the gate spell with ita445 opening a portal to the plane keyed to that side. Alternativelya445 if you use an action to press one side twicea445 you can cast the plane shift spell (save DC 17) with the cube and transport the targets to the plane keyed to that side.a446The cube has 3 charges. Each use of the cube expends 1 charge. The cube regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Name: Deck of Many Things
Description: Usually found in a box or poucha445 this deck contains a number of cards made of ivory or vellum. Most (75 percent) of these decks have only thirteen cardsa445 but the rest have twenty-two.a446Before you draw a carda445 you must declare how many cards you intend to draw and then draw them randomly (you can use an altered deck of playing cards to simulate the deck). Any cards drawn in excess of this number have no effect. Otherwisea445 as soon as you draw a card from the decka445 its magic takes effect. You must draw each card no more than 1 hour after the previous draw. If you fail to draw the chosen numbera445 the remaining number of cards fly from the deck on their own and take effect all at once.a446Once a card is drawna445 it fades from existence. Unless the card is the Fool or the Jestera445 the card reappears in the decka445 making it possible to draw the same card twice.a446A Question of Enmity. Two of the cards in a deck of many things can earn a character the enmity of another being. With the Flames carda445 the enmity is overt. The character should experience the devil's malevolent efforts on multiple occasions. Seeking out the fiend shouldn't be a simple taska445 and the adventurer should clash with the devil's allies and followers a few times before being able to confront the devil itself.a446In the case of the Rogue carda445 the enmity is secret and should come from someone thought to be a friend or an ally. As Dungeon Mastera445 you should wait for a dramatically appropriate moment to reveal this enmitya445 leaving the adventurer guessing who is likely to become a betrayer.a446Playing Card        Card        Effecta446Ace of diamonds        Vizier*        At any time you choose within one year of drawing this carda445 you can ask a question in meditation and mentally receive a truthful answer to that question. Besides informationa445 the answer helps you solve a puzzling problem or other dilemma. In other wordsa445 the knowledge comes with wisdom on how to apply it.a446King of diamonds        Sun        You gain 50a445000 XPa445 and a wondrous item (which the DM determines randomly) appears in your hands.a446Queen of diamonds        Moon        You are granted the ability to cast the wish spell 1d3 times.a446Jack of diamonds        Star        Increase one of your ability scores by 2. The score can exceed 20 but can't exceed 24.a446Two of diamonds        Comet*        If you single-handedly defeat the next hostile monster or group of monsters you encountera445 you gain experience points enough to gain one level. Otherwisea445 this card has no effect.a446Ace of hearts        The Fates*        Reality's fabric unravels and spins anewa445 allowing you to avoid or erase one event as if it never happened. You can use the card's magic as soon as you draw the card or at any other time before you die.a446King of hearts        Throne        You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skilla445 and you double your proficiency bonus on checks made with that skill. In additiona445 you gain rightful ownership of a small keep somewhere in the world. Howevera445 the keep is currently in the hands of monstersa445 which you must clear out before you can claim the keep as yours.a446Queen of hearts        Key        A rare or rarer magic weapon with which you are proficient appears in your hands. The DM chooses the weapon.a446Jack of hearts        Knight        You gain the service of a 4th-level fighter who appears in a space you choose within 30 feet of you. The fighter is of the same race as you and serves you loyally until deatha445 believing the fates have drawn him or her to you. You control this character.a446Two of hearts        Gem*        Twenty-five pieces of jewelry worth 2a445000 gp each or fifty gems worth 1a445000 gp each appear at your feet.a446Ace of clubs        Talons*        Every magic item you wear or carry disintegrates. Artifacts in your possession aren't destroyed but do vanish.a446King of clubs        The Void        This black card spells disaster. Your soul is drawn from your body and contained in an object in a place of the DM's choice. One or more powerful beings guard the place. While your soul is trapped in this waya445 your body is incapacitated. A wish spell can't restore your soula445 but the spell reveals the location of the object that holds it. You draw no more cards.a446Queen of clubs        Flames        A powerful devil becomes your enemy. The devil seeks your ruin and plagues your lifea445 savoring your suffering before attempting to slay you. This enmity lasts until either you or the devil dies.a446Jack of clubs        Skull        You summon an avatar of death-a ghostly humanoid skeleton clad in a tattered black robe and carrying a spectral scythe. It appears in a space of the DM's choice within 10 feet of you and attacks youa445 warning all others that you must win the battle alone. The avatar fights until you die or it drops to 0 hit pointsa445 whereupon it disappears. If anyone tries to help youa445 the helper summons its own avatar of death. A creature slain by an avatar of death can't be restored to life.a446Two of clubs        Idiot*        Permanently reduce your Intelligence by 1d4 + 1 (to a minimum score of 1). You can draw one additional card beyond your declared draws.a446Ace of spades        Donjon*        You disappear and become entombed in a state of suspended animation in an extradimensional sphere. Everything you were wearing and carrying stays behind in the space you occupied when you disappeared. You remain imprisoned until you are found and removed from the sphere. You can't be located by any divination magica445 but a wish spell can reveal the location of your prison. You draw no more cards.a446King of spades        Ruin        All forms of wealth that you carry or owna445 other than magic itemsa445 are lost to you. Portable property vanishes. Businessesa445 buildingsa445 and land you own are lost in a way that alters reality the least. Any documentation that proves you should own something lost to this card also disappears.a446Queen of spades        Euryale        The card's medusa-like visage curses you. You take a -2 penalty on saving throws while cursed in this way. Only a god or the magic of The Fates card can end this curse.a446Jack of spades        Rogue        A nonplayer character of the DM's choice becomes hostile toward you. The identity of your new enemy isn't known until the NPC or someone else reveals it. Nothing less than a wish spell or divine intervention can end the NPC's hostility toward you.a446Two of spades        Balance*        Your mind suffers a wrenching alterationa445 causing your alignment to change. Lawful becomes chaotica445 good becomes evila445 and vice versa. If you are true neutral or unaligneda445 this card has no effect on you.a446Joker (with TM)        Fool*        You lose 10a445000 XPa445 discard this carda445 and draw from the deck againa445 counting both draws as one of your declared draws. If losing that much XP would cause you to lose a levela445 you instead lose an amount that leaves you with just enough XP to keep your level.a446Joker (without TM)        Jester        You gain 10a445000 XPa445 or you can draw two additional cards beyond your declared draws.a446* Found only in a deck with twenty-two cards

Name: Icon of Ravenloft
Description: The Icon of Ravenloft is a 12-inch tall statuette made of the purest silvera445 weighing 10 pounds. It depicts a cleric kneeling in supplication.a446The icon was given to Strahd by the archpriest Ciril Romulicha445 an old family frienda445 to consecrate the castle and its chapel.a446While within 30 feet of the icona445 a creature is under the effect of a protection from evil and good spell against fiends and undead. Only a creature attuned to the icon can use its other properties.a446Augury. You can use an action to cast an augury spell from the icona445 with no material components required. Once useda445 this property can't be used again until the next dawn.a446Bane of the Undead. You can use the icon as a holy symbol while using the Turn Undead or Turn the Unholy feature. If you do soa445 increase the save DC by 2.a446Cure Wounds. While holding the icona445 you can take an action to heal one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. The target regains 3d8 + 3 hit pointsa445 unless it is an undeada445 a constructa445 or a fiend. Once useda445 this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Name: Instrument of the Bard – Ollamh Harp
Description: An instrument of the bards is an exquisite example of its kinda445 superior to an ordinary instrument in every way. Seven types of these instruments exista445 each named after a legendary bard college. A creature that attempts to play the instrument without being attuned to it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d4 psychic damage.a446You can use an action to play the instrument and cast one of its spells. Once the instrument has been used to cast a spella445 it can't be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn. The spells use your spellcasting ability and spell save DC.a446You can play the instrument while casting a spell that causes any of its targets to be charmed on a failed saving throwa445 thereby imposing disadvantage on the save. This effect applies only if the spell has a somatic or a material component.a446All instruments of the bards can be used to cast the following spells: flya445 invisibilitya445 levitatea445 and protection from evil and good.a446In additiona445 the Ollamh harp can be used to cast confusiona445 control weathera445 and fire storm.a446If you have proficiency with a given musical instrumenta445 you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.a446A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focusa445 substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.a446Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.a446See the Tool Proficiencies entry for more information.a446Proficiency with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.a446History. Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.a446Performance. Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.a446Compose a Tune. As part of a long resta445 you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.a446Musical Instrumenta446Activity        DCa446Identify a tune        10a446Improvise a tune        20

Name: Iron Horn of Valhalla
Description: You can use an action to blow this horn. In responsea445 warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear within 60 feet of you. These spirits use the berserker statistics. They return to Ysgard after 1 hour or when they drop to 0 hit points. Once you use the horna445 it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.a446The iron horn summons 5d4 + 5 berserkers. To use the iron horna445 you must be proficient with all martial weapons.a446If you blow the horn without meeting its requirementa445 the summoned berserkers attack you. If you meet the requirementa445 they are friendly to you and your companions and follow your commands.

Name: Sovereign Glue
Description: This viscousa445 milky-white substance can form a permanent adhesive bond between any two objects. It must be stored in a jar or flask that has been coated inside with oil of slipperiness. When founda445 a container contains 1d6 + 1 ounces.a446One ounce of the glue can cover a 1-foot square surface. The glue takes 1 minute to set. Once it has done soa445 the bond it creates can be broken only by the application of universal solvent or oil of etherealnessa445 or with a wish spell.

Name: Sphere of Annihilation
Description: This 2-foot-diameter black sphere is a hole in the multiversea445 hovering in space and stabilized by a magical field surrounding it.a446The sphere obliterates all matter it passes through and all matter that passes through it. Artifacts are the exception. Unless an artifact is susceptible to damage from a sphere of annihilationa445 it passes through the sphere unscathed. Anything else that touches the sphere but isn't wholly engulfed and obliterated by it takes 4d10 force damage.a446The sphere is stationary until someone controls it. If you are within 60 feet of an uncontrolled spherea445 you can use an action to make a DC 25 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a successa445 the sphere levitates in one direction of your choicea445 up to a number of feet equal to 5 × your Intelligence modifier (minimum 5 feet). On a failurea445 the sphere moves 10 feet toward you. A creature whose space the sphere enters must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or be touched by ita445 taking 4d10 force damage.a446If you attempt to control a sphere that is under another creature's controla445 you make an Intelligence (Arcana) check contested by the other creature's Intelligence (Arcana) check. The winner of the contest gains control of the sphere and can levitate it as normal.a446If the sphere comes into contact with a planar portala445 such as that created by the gate spella445 or an extradimensional spacea445 such as that within a portable holea445 the DM determines randomly what happensa445 using the following table.a446d100        Resulta44601-50        The sphere is destroyed.a44651-85        The sphere moves through the portal or into the extradimensional space.a44686-00        A spatial rift sends each creature and object within 180 feet of the spherea445 including the spherea445 to a random plane of existence.

Name: Talisman of Pure Good
Description: This talisman is a mighty symbol of goodness. A creature that is neither good nor evil in alignment takes 6d6 radiant damage upon touching the talisman. An evil creature takes 8d6 radiant damage upon touching the talisman. Either sort of creature takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman.a446If you are a good cleric or paladina445 you can use the talisman as a holy symbola445 and you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear or hold it.a446The talisman has 7 charges. If you are wearing or holding ita445 you can use an action to expend 1 charge from it and choose one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of you. If the target is of evil alignmenta445 a flaming fissure opens under it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or fall into the fissure and be destroyeda445 leaving no remains. The fissure then closesa445 leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last chargea445 the talisman disperses into motes of golden light and is destroyed.

Name: Talisman of the Sphere
Description: When you make an Intelligence (Arcana) check to control a sphere of annihilation while you are holding this talismana445 you double your proficiency bonus on the check. In additiona445 when you start your turn with control over a sphere of annihilationa445 you can use an action to levitate it 10 feet plus a number of additional feet equal to 10 × your Intelligence modifier.

Name: Talisman of Ultimate Evil
Description: This item symbolizes unrepentant evil. A creature that is neither good nor evil in alignment takes 6d6 necrotic damage upon touching the talisman. A good creature takes 8d6 necrotic damage upon touching the talisman. Either sort of creature takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman.a446If you are an evil cleric or paladina445 you can use the talisman as a holy symbola445 and you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear or hold it.a446The talisman has 6 charges. If you are wearing or holding ita445 you can use an action to expend 1 charge from the talisman and choose one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of you. If the target is of good alignmenta445 a flaming fissure opens under it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or fall into the fissure and be destroyeda445 leaving no remains. The fissure then closesa445 leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last chargea445 the talisman dissolves into foul-smelling slime and is destroyed.

Name: Universal Solvent
Description: This tube holds milky liquid with a strong alcohol smell. You can use an action to pour the contents of the tube onto a surface within reach. The liquid instantly dissolves up to 1 square foot of adhesive it touchesa445 including sovereign glue.

Name: Well of Many Worlds
Description: This fine black clotha445 soft as silka445 is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter.a446You can use an action to unfold and place the well of many worlds on a solid surfacea445 whereupon it creates a two-way portal to another world or plane of existence. Each time the item opens a portala445 the DM decides where it leads. You can use an action to close an open portal by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Once well of many worlds has opened a portala445 it can't do so again for 1d8 hours.

Name: 2x Base Items - Dagger Bullseye Lantern Steel Mirror 10' Pole 50= Hempen Rope Sack
A Riding Horse with saddle bags
